title: Particle motion - velocity from position function

content.question: The position of a particle moving in the xy-plane is given by the parametric equations <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamiEamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyyp a0JaamiDa8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIZaaaaOGaeyOeI0IaaG4mai aadshapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaaaaa@43B1@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamyEamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyyp a0JaaGymaiaaikdacaWG0bGaeyOeI0IaaG4maiaadshapaWaaWbaaS qabeaapeGaaGOmaaaaaaa@4416@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> At which of the following points (x, y) is the particle at rest?
